meanings.definition: relating to the art or technique of dramatic composition
meanings.sent1: The playwright's dramaturgical skills were evident in the well-crafted dialogue.
meanings.sent2: She attended a dramaturgical workshop to improve her playwriting.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgical approach to storytelling added depth to the script.
meanings.sent4: His dramaturgical expertise transformed the play into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturgical elements of the play captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the writing or production of plays
meanings.sent1: The dramaturgical process involves script analysis and revisions.
meanings.sent2: The theater company hired a dramaturgical consultant for the new production.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgical team worked tirelessly to perfect the play.
meanings.sent4: Her dramaturgical insights enhanced the overall performance.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturgical aspects of the play were carefully planned and executed.

meanings.definition: characterized by a focus on the structure and content of a theatrical performance
meanings.sent1: The director took a dramaturgical approach to staging the play.
meanings.sent2: The dramaturgical analysis highlighted the themes of the production.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgical perspective provided valuable insights into the play.
meanings.sent4: The dramaturgical elements of the performance were meticulously planned.
meanings.sent5: Her dramaturgical expertise ensured a cohesive and engaging production.
